sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: File.Delete is used to delete the file specified by the parameter filePathName. This is the equivalent of doing a del in DOS or rm in UNIX.
sections.text_content: File.Delete is used to delete the file specified by the parameter filePathName. This is the equivalent of doing a del in DOS or rm in UNIX.
sections.mdown_content: **File.Delete** is used to delete the file specified by the parameter *filePathName*. This is the equivalent of doing a **del** in DOS or **rm** in UNIX.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: If the File.Delete call fails, then Error.Last will return a non-zero value indicating the reason for the failure. Error.LastMsg will return a string which contains the textual version of the error.
sections.text_content: If the File.Delete call fails, then Error.Last will return a non-zero value indicating the reason for the failure. Error.LastMsg will return a string which contains the textual version of the error.
sections.mdown_content: If the **File.Delete** call fails, then **Error.Last** will return a non-zero value indicating the reason for the failure. **Error.LastMsg** will return a string which contains the textual version of the error.

sections.title: Example
code:
File.Delete ("information")
        if Error.Last = eNoError then
            put "File delete"
        else
            put "Did not delete the file."
            put "Error: ", Error.LastMsg
        end if
sections.raw_content: This program deletes the file called information.
sections.text_content: This program deletes the file called information.
sections.mdown_content: This program deletes the file called *information*.

sections.title: Execute
sections.raw_content: An example program is available that creates a file in the current directory, and then deletes the file using File.Delete.
sections.text_content:
An example program is available that creates a file in the current 
        directory, and then deletes the file using File.Delete.
sections.mdown_content: An example program is available that creates a file in the current directory, and then deletes the file using **File.Delete**.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling File.Delete, not by calling File.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling File.Delete, not by calling File.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling **File.Delete**, not by calling **File**.
